Key Match Events: Ryan Christie scored the first goal for Scotland in the 58th minute.
Che Adams scored the second goal for Scotland in the 85th minute.
Liam Cooper limped off due to injury in the second half.
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland were looking to end a 19-year winless streak against lower-ranked teams.
Steve Clarke made several substitutions, including the debut of Ross McCrorie and the return of James Forrest.
Scotland had multiple injury concerns before the match, including Lyndon Dykes and Nathan Patterson.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Clarke praised the team's resilience despite the injuries.
The victory was seen as a much-needed boost for Scotland's preparations for Euro 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland had several chances in the first half but struggled to convert them.
Gibraltar's Zander Clark made several saves, including a close-range miss by Hanley.
Others: The match was played in Faro, Portugal, with no significant weather or pitch conditions affecting play.
